greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Arrange numbers in a clockwise spiral with initial terms a(1)=1, a(2)=2, a(4)=3, a(6)=4, a(8)=5; thereafter each number shares a factor with each of its four (N,S,E,W) neighbors.
comment: Start with smallest number which has not yet appeared and satisfies the conditions: a(3)=6; thereafter always choose smallest number which has not yet appeared and satisfies the conditions.
This is a two-dimensional spiral analog of EKG sequence A064413.
In A064413 we have initial terms in the positions 1,2.
In the two-dimensional case we have 4 sides.
But the POSITIONS in the spiral are indexed thus:
So the initial terms, by (1), are a(1)=1, a(2)=2, a(4)=3, a(6)=4, a(8)=5.
Conjecture: The sequence is a permutation of the positive integers. - _Vladimir Shevelev_, May 06 2015
link: Peter J. C. Moses, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5625
Peter J. C. Moses, The first few squares.
results.author: _Vladimir Shevelev_, May 02 2015
ext: Correction of a(42) and more terms from _Peter J. C. Moses_, May 03 2015
